# Lists :
p(62-p72)


1.Numbered lists(Ordered lists)created with(`<ol>`and the element with `<li>`).


2.Bullet lists(Unordered lists )( created with`<ul>` and the element with`<li>`)


3.Definition lists: gives definition .(created with `<dl>` and the elimant created whith `<dt>` ,`<dt>`used to contain the
definition. )    


*Lists can be nested inside one another*


(pp.300-329)
## Boxes


1. Controlling size of boxes(width, height)
2. Box model for borders, margin and padding


![](https://s1.o7planning.com/en/12495/images/51081143.gif)


3. Displaying and hiding boxes

> **Legibility can be improved by controlling the width of
boxes containing text and the leading.
X CSS3 has introduced the ability to create image
borders and rounded borders.**

2. STRING DATA TYPE
3. BOOLEAN DATA TYPE

(pp.162-182)
#### if e1se statement

1. The if/else statement: executes a block of code if a specified condition is true. If the condition is false, another block of code can be executed



![](data:image/png;base64,)

2. Switch Statment:
switch (value){ case 1: do code; break; case 2: do code; break; ... ... ... default: default code; break: }

3. For Loops.

4. While Loops.
